oai_dc:dc.dc:title: LIQUID-LIQUID-EXTRACTION OF COPPER(II) WITH CRYPTAND-222 WITH ERYTHROSINE-B AS THE COUNTERION
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GANDHI, MN
KHOPKAR, SM
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: compound 1,4,8,11-tetrathiacyclotetradecane
separation
solvent extraction
cryptand-222
copper(ii)
erythrosine-b
environmental samples
separation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Copper is extracted at pH 5.5 with 3 x 10(-4) M cryptand 222 in dichloromethane with 3 x 10(-4) M erythrosine B as the counter-ion. It can be stripped with 0.5 M perchloric acid and determined by atomic absorption spectrometry at 324.7 nm. Copper has been separated from multicomponent mixtures containing zinc, mercury, iron, cobalt, nickel and manganese, which are generally encountered in environmental samples.
